title: Investment Return Calculator

seo.title: Investment Return Calculator | ROI & Total Profit
seo.description: Calculate your total investment return, ROI percentage, and annualized return. See how your initial investment grows over time with contributions.

summary: Did you beat the market? Use this calculator to find your total and annualized returns on any investment.

faq.a: A 'good' ROI depends on risk. For safe bonds, 4-5% is good. For the stock market, 7-10% is average. For high-risk startups, investors look for 300%+.

faq.q: What is the difference between Total Return and Annualized Return?
faq.a: Total Return is the simple percentage gain (e.g., +50%). Annualized Return (CAGR) tells you what that growth looks like per year (e.g., +8.4% per year for 5 years).
For the most accurate result, 'Ending Balance' should include the current value of your shares PLUS all dividends received and reinvested.

article.heading: ROI vs. CAGR: Which Matters?
article.body:
If you doubled your money, your ROI is 100%. That sounds amazing. But if it took you 20 years to do it, your Annualized Return (CAGR) is only 3.5%. That's barely beating inflation.

**Key Takeaway:** Always look at Annualized Return to judge the efficiency of an investment.

article.heading: The Rule of 72
article.body:
Want a quick mental math trick? Divide 72 by your Annualized Return to see how many years it takes to double your money.
*   At 6%, it takes 12 years (72/6).
*   At 12%, it takes 6 years (72/12).
